text: Is this an MRG?
Could you add some seealso in the docstring of the new functions, and maybe the load_mni152
Also, there needs entries added in the modules/reference.rst for the reference documentation.
I don't see the holes as been a problem. It would be interesting to check whether they are actually holes in 3D, or just seen as such on the cuts.
I am pushing new commit which contains grey matter mask. Just about to push.

@GaelVaroquaux please could you check ? How it goes ?

![gery](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11410385/15894322/8b019124-2d85-11e6-911e-8004eeb6d693.png)

So far grey matter output:
![grey_comparison](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11410385/15901018/e08fd9f4-2da1-11e6-8d12-467f0a234ded.png)

@GaelVaroquaux Any quick advice how to complete holes ?

Side: threshold=0.5 or 0.2 doesn't show any difference
I checked seen as cuts.

@GaelVaroquaux I addressed your comments. Thanks.

Just a curious question: Do you think we need an example showing how to analyze this mask in their own data processing ? If Yes, how do I start ?
Maybe `load_mni152_brain_mask` would be a better naming?

text: The mask seems very permissive, why .2? .5 seems more logical to me.

text:
> The mask seems very permissive, why .2? .5 seems more logical to me.

Let's make it an optional argument. Permissive masks are usual a good
idea, however, so I think that .2 is a good default.

For me too, for completeness I would post some pictures between those two values.
